intro: Indigofera secundiflora var. holstii, commonly known as the Mexican indigo, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant produces cylindrical, woody pods that contain lens-shaped seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the legume family, Fabaceae.
